question: Some people think that it is too difficult for poor people or people from rural areas to go to university. So that the universities should make it especially easy for them. To what extent do you agree or disagree.
text: Some say going to university can be too burdensome for deprived community or individuals from remote areas. Therefore, academic institutions should not make it difficult for them. Although I agree with the statement, I believe that university should still do a thorough review and regulations in order for them to pursue a college degree.

On the one hand, fundamentally, all individuals should have the same opportunity to get exposed to formal education regardless of their status and conditions. For example, formal academic such as university can help those who are struggling by providing them a scholarships for an excellent students, or student loans or accommodation closer to the varsity for those who live in rural area so that it will lessen their burden in transportation. In addition, if the pupils are motivated by the aids of the academy, it is more likely they can give the best contribution to the school and society after graduation.
On the other hand, although it is a great idea to make it especially easy for indigent group or

Countryside community, it best believe to not  give it too lightly to all the people just because they are poor or live in rural area, because it can cause some disadvantages too such as, some of them might spoiled the freedom that they are given, like does not take their study seriously just because it’s easy for them to get in. Therefore, the university should do a thorough review and regulations for the students who is willing to dedicate their study. Since might not all of them want to pursue a formal education.

To conclude, I admittedly agree for academy institutions should lessen their burden to pursue a study. However, university still have to give a restrict requirements so that only the highly motivated students can get the full advantage from the school’s aids.
